title: HPV Integration Detection
description: Identify HPV integration sites in genomes using nf-core/viralintegration pipeline
content:
HPV Integration Detection Pipeline

Identify Human Papillomavirus (HPV) integration events in genomes using a chimeric read approach with the nf-core/viralintegration pipeline.

Overview

This pipeline detects viral DNA integration sites in host genomes, which is a key event in HPV-associated carcinogenesis, particularly in cervical cancer. The workflow analyzes sequencing data to identify chimeric reads spanning human-viral genomic junctions.

Key Features

  • Automated Quality Control: Performs comprehensive read quality assessment and trimming
  • Chimeric Read Detection: Identifies reads spanning human-viral genome boundaries
  • Integration Site Analysis: Pinpoints exact genomic locations of viral integration
  • Interactive Reports: Generates genome viewers and detailed summary reports
  • Best Practices: Follows nf-core bioinformatics standards with full reproducibility

Workflow Steps

  1. Input validation and quality control
  2. Human genome alignment
  3. Quality trimming and filtering
  4. Chimeric read identification
  5. Virus report generation
  6. Integration site verification
  7. Summary report creation

Input Requirements

Prepare a samplesheet in CSV or TSV format containing sample identifiers and paths to FASTQ files. The pipeline supports both single-end and paired-end sequencing data.

Clinical Relevance

HPV integration into the host genome is associated with cervical carcinogenesis and other HPV-related malignancies. Common integration hotspots include genes such as MACROD2, MIPOL1/TTC6, and TP63. This pipeline enables precise identification of integration sites for research and diagnostic applications.

Output

Results include aligned BAM files, integration site coordinates, interactive genome visualizations, and comprehensive QC metrics in the specified output directory.
